title: Ticket #5371: schedd crashes during fast shutdown intermittently
description:
During a fast shutdown, the schedd will crash if there are running forkwork'ed children, perhaps from a condor_q in flight. The stack trace looks like this: 

Stack dump for process 63178 at timestamp 1446687642 (17 frames)
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(dprintf_dump_stack+0x12d)[0x2ba86881eaad]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(+0x15af92)[0x2ba868831f92]
/lib64/libpthread.so.0[0x33fb20f790]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_ZN10DaemonCore11Send_SignalE18classy_counted_ptrI11DCSignalMsgEb+0x57)[0x2ba868970517]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_ZN10DaemonCore11Send_SignalEii+0x76)[0x2ba868971416]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_ZN8ForkWork7KillAllEb+0x88)[0x2ba8688c46d8]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_ZN8ForkWork9DeleteAllEv+0x15)[0x2ba8688c4735]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_ZN8ForkWorkD1Ev+0x1b)[0x2ba8688c4a4b]
/lib64/libc.so.6(exit+0xe2)[0x33faa35b22]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(__wrap_exit+0x73)[0x2ba86896a4f3]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_Z7DC_ExitiPKc+0x219)[0x2ba868959a59]
condor_schedd[0x449680]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_Z17handle_dc_sigquitP7Servicei+0x31)[0x2ba8689557a1]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_ZN10DaemonCore6DriverEv+0x946)[0x2ba868978576]
/slots/07/dir_14290/userdir/condor/lib/libcondor_utils_8_5_2.so(_Z7dc_mainiPPc+0x1799)[0x2ba868958d89]
/lib64/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xfd)[0x33faa1ed5d]
condor_schedd[0x4213a9]

The problem is that the ForkWork object is a global in qmgmt, and the destructor is called by the system after exit is called. However, when the ForkWork destructor is called, the DaemonCore singleton instance is guaranteed to already be deleted (we do it explicitly, before calling exit). The ForkWork destructor kills any running child proceses via DaemonCore::Send_Signal, but the daemonCore instance has already been deleted and set to null, so we crash.

Note this isn't a problem for a graceful shutdown of the schedd, for there we explicitly tell ForkWork to kill all the children before calling DC_Exit for this very reason.

For 8.4, I'll just duplicate this code in the graceful shutdown code, but we should probably move ForkWork into DaemonCore for 8.5, as it depends on Dc.
